titleStmt.title: Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary” / Täʾamrä Iyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” / Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq... “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…” / Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.title: I. Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.note: I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah; I-2) Introductory exhortation; I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki “I Worship Thee…”; I-4) 76 miracles of Mary.

msItem.title: I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat – Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 1ra, l.1: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ እምቅድመ፡ ያንብቡ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ ለእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ሥርዓት፡ ዘወፅአ፡ እምንበረ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ እመካነ፡ መዓልቃ፡ ዘምስር፡ ዘአንበሩ፡ መምህራን፡ መጋብያነ፡ ምሥጢር፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት።[Fol. 1ra, l.1] In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the seat of Mark the Apostle, from the church of Mäʿalqa (al-Muʿallaqah) of Mǝsr (i.e. Cairo) wherein the doctors, the glorious patriarchs, the treasurers of the mystery, the righteous had laid it up.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 7vb, l.13: ለከ፡ ይደሉ፡ ስብሐት፡ በጽዮን፨ ወለከ፡ ይትፈና፡ ጸሎት፡ በኢየሩሳሌም፨ ስማዕ፡ ጸሎተ፡ ዘሥጋ፡…

note.p: In the margin, fol. 6r: ወኢይመስሎ

Fol. 1ra, l.1 - 5ra, l.4: Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat (1st part); Fol. 5ra, l. 5 - 5va, l.1: Haleluya Haleluya sälam lä-Maryam nǝgǝśt; Fol. 5va, l. 16 - 6ra, l.11: Sälam to the Apostles; Fol.5va, l. 11 - 7vb, l.17: Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat (2nd part)

msItem.title: I-2) Introductory exhortation
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 8ra, l.1: መቅድመ፡ ተአምር፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ በሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን። ንነግረክሙ፡ አኃዊነ፡ ፍቁራን፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ እግዚአብሔር፡ይባርክሙ፡ ወያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ አልባቢክሙ፨ ለሰሚዓ፡ ተአምሪሃ፡ለእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም፡…[Fol. 8ra, l.1]: The foreword of the miracles which to be read during the Christian Sunday. We will tell you, our brothers, children of the church, may God bless you and enlighten the eyes of your hearts to listen to the miracles of our Lady Mary, the holy and twofold Virgin.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 11rb, l.15: ቅዱሳን፡ ወንጹሐን፡ ድንግልናኪ፡ እለ፡ ይሴብሑ። ኀበ፡ ሥዕልኪ፡ እንዘ፡ ይጸርኁ፡[Fol. 11va] ብርሃነ፡ ጸጋኪ፡ ይትሞጥሑ፡ ኀበ፡ ቤተ፡ መርዓሁ፡ ለወልድኪ፡ ያንፈርዕፁ፡ ወይትፌሥሑ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ በስራሕ፨

note.p: Fol. 8ra - 10ra, l.1: Introductory exhortation;
Fol. 10ra, l.2 - 10rb, l.2: ʾO ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bäkǝlʾe Maryam ṣälotǝki wäbäräkätǝki… (cf.UM-014,UM-016);
Fol. 10rb, l.3 - 10va, l.9: Zä-qädämit sänbät mǝnbäb ʾO ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bäkǝlʾe Maryam ʾǝmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos… (cf.UM-014,UM-016,UM-029);
Fol.10va, l.10 - 11va, l.6: Sälam läki o ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmu lä-bǝrhan (cf.UM-014,UM-016,UM-029).

msItem.title: I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki “I worship Thee…”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 11va, l.7: እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ ወእዌድሰኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለመርዓዊ፡ {ሰማይ}፡ ጽርሑ፨ በከመ፡ ወደስኪ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አፈ፡ ወርቅ፡ በመኃልይሁ፡…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 12vb, l.1: ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ሰአሊ፡ ወጸልዪ፡ ኀበ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልድኪ፡ ከመ፡ ይስረይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨

msItem.title: I-4) Miracles of Mary
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 13ra, l.1 (Miracle 1): በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አሐዱ፡ ወመንፈስ [sic]፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ንቀድም፡ በረድኤተኤተ[sic]፡ እግዚእነ፡ ኢያሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወበስነ፡ ሀብቱ፡ በጽሒፈ፡ ተአምረሃ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በክልኤ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ዘኢይክሉ፡ ፈጽሞ፡ ነጊረ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ ወውዳሴሃ፡ ኢሰማያውያን፡ ወኢምድራውያን፡ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ዓመታ፡…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 125vb, l.3 (Miracle 79): ወዕለቱ፡ አመ፡ ፯፡ ለነሐሴ፡ ርእዩኬ፡ዘከመ፡ ታፈቅር፡ ወትረድኦሙ፡ ለክርስቲያን፡ ወታወድቆሙ፡ ለአረሚ፡አግብርተ፡ ሠይጣን፨ እግዚእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ በረከተ፡ ጸሎታ፡ የሀሉ፡ምስለ፡ አግብርቲሃ፡…

note.p: I-3)-1: Fols. 13ra-14vb: About Ildefonsus (Däqǝsyos) of Toledo (Ṭǝlṭǝlyaya)

(BMirMA 10-12; BHMirM 1-4; CerMaria310-316; ColMirM 23-24 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-7; éth. 60, fols. 8-10, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-1; Orient. 8814, fols.98r-100v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-1).
I-3)-2: Fols. 15ra-15rb: End of an undefined miracle.
I-3)-3. Fols. 15rb-16va: The Virgin Mary protects a pregnant woman from drowning during the feast of St. Michael (ColMirM 50-51).

I-3)-4. Fols. 16va-19rb: The Virgin Mary and the cannibal of Qǝmǝr (BMirMA 46-47; BHMirM 94-97; ColMirM176-180// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 102, no. 32, I, D.-29; éth. 60, fols. 49-52, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-30; Orient. 8814, fols. 156v-160r, StrBritLib 48, no. 32, 16.-29).

I-3)-5. Fols. 19rb-19vb: The death of Nestorius (CerMaria213-215// mss. d´Abbadie 165, fols. 100r-100v, CRAbb 82, no. 52; d´Abbadie 222, fols. 45v-46r, CRAbb 85, no. 53; Vat. Et. 43, fols.232-333, GréTisVat I 188, no. 43).
I-3)-6. Fols. 19vb-20va: About three virgins who served Mary (mss. d´Abbadie 165, fols.99v-100r, CRAbb 82, no. 52).

I-3)-7. Fols. 20va-21rb: The spring of Mǝḥṣab, part of the Synaxarium of 8 Säne (GuiSyn I568-570, CerMaria 29, 37 // mss. éth. 60, fols. 147v-148, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-85; éth. 62, fols. 38v-39v, ZotBNat 68, no. 60-25; O Ethiop. 11, LöfUpp 89, no. 30, F.-6).
I-3)-8. Fols. 21rb-22rb: The Virgin Mary, on a chariot with her son and crowned with pearls, appeared to the Apostles.
I-3)-9. Fols. 22rb-22vb: Apparition of Mary to John Chrysostom (mss. éth. 60, fols. 173v-174, ZotBNat 67, no.60-104).
I-3)-10. Fols. 23ra-24vb: Miracle of the sycamore at Däbrä Mǝṭmaq (mss. éth. 60, fols. 135v-137v, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-79).
I-3)-11. Fols. 24vb-27va:The Virgin Mary cursed an Egyptian woman who did not want to give them water (mss. éth. 60, fols. 144v-147v, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-84).
I-3)-12. Fols. 27va-29ra: The Virgin Mary destroyed an Egyptian town whose inhabitants did not accommodate the holy family well (mss. éth. 60, fols. 137v-139, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-80).
I-3)-13. Fols. 29ra-30rb: The Virgin Mary cursed inhabitants of an Egyptian town in turning them into baboons (mss. éth. 60, fols. 140v-142, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-82).
I-3)-14. Fols. 30va-32va: About the king of an Egyptian town who invited the Virgin Mary and three thousand inhabitants were cured (mss. éth. 60, fols.142-144, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-83).
I-3)-15. Fols. 32va-33ra: The Virgin Mary appeared to a poor monk who had no food and clothes who prays her every day.

I-3)-16. Fols. 33ra-33vb: The Virgin Mary and the workman (BMirMA 13; BHMirM 6-7 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-9; éth. 60, fols. 11-12, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-3; Orient. 8814, fols. 100v-101r, StrBritLib 46, no. 32,16.-2).

I-3)-17. Fols. 33vb-34va: The Jew of the city of Akhmim (BMirMA 14; BHMirM 8-9; CerMaria219-225; ColMirM452-453// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-10; éth. 60, fols. 12-13, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-4; Orient. 8814, fols. 101r-103v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-3).

I-3)-18. Fols. 34va-35rb: The Virgin Mary and the scribe Damianus (Dǝmyanos) of Philippi (Fǝlǝṗäsyos) (BMirMA 15; BHMirM 10-13; ColMirM 512 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-11; éth. 60, fols. 13-14, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-5; Orient. 8814, fols. 103v-104v, StrBritLib 46, no. 32, 16.-4).

I-3)-19. Fols. 35rb-36ra: The Virgin Mary and bishop ʾAbbas (the pope Leon) (BMirMA 14-16; BHMirM 14-16; CerMaria436-444// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-12; éth. 60, fols. 14-15v, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-6; Orient. 8814, fols. 104v-106v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-5).

I-3)-20. Fols. 36ra-37ra: The Virgin Mary and monk Isaac (BMirMA 17-18; BHMirM 20-22; ColMirM 265-273// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-13; éth. 60, fols. 15v-17, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-7; Orient. 8814, fols. 106v-108v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-6).

I-3)-21. Fols. 37va-38rb: The Virgin Mary and the child Mary of Däfra (BHMirM 23-25; BMirMA 18-19; CerMaria191-194// mss. éth. 60, fols. 17-18, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-8; Orient. 8814, fols. 108v-110v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32-7).

I-3)-22. Fols. 38rb-39rb: The Virgin Mary and the painter decorating a church in France (hagärä Afransa) (BMirMA 19-20; BHMirM 26-32 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-15; éth. 60, fols. 18-19v, ZotBNat 62, no. 60-9; Orient. 8814, fols. 110v-112v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-8).

I-3)-23. Fols. 39rb-39vb: The Virgin Mary and the sick monk in the ‟Monastery of Pilgers” (Däbrä Näggadǝyan) (BMirMA 20-21; BHMirM 33-34; CerMaria 192 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-16; éth. 60, fols. 19v-20v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-10; Orient. 8814, fols. 112v-114r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-9).

I-3)-24. Fols. 39vb-41ra: The Virgin Mary and the youth Zachary (BMirMA 21-22; BHMirM 35-37; ColMirM 85-86 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-1; éth. 60, fols. 20v-22v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-11; Orient. 8814, fols. 114r-117v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-10).
I-3)-25. Fols. 41ra-42rb: The two women, the robbers and the flute.

I-3)-26. Fols. 42rb-43ra: The Virgin Mary and the church of ʿƎqona, which was moved to the edge of the sea (BMirMA 25; BHMirM 45-46; ColMirM 171// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-4; éth. 60, fols. 24v-25v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-14; Orient. 8814, fols.121v-123v, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-13).

I-3)-27. Fols. 43ra-44ra: The Virgin Mary and the blind Egyptian Priest John Bäkänsi (BMirMA 26-27; BHMirM 47-49; ColMirM283-284// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-5; éth. 60, fols. 25v-27, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-15; Orient. 8814, fols. 123v-126r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-14).

I-3)-28. Fols. 44ra-45vb: The Virgin Mary and the man of the island of Qwäläsyǝs who had a dart in his eye (BMirMA 28-29; BHMirM 53-55; ColMirM285-286// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 100, no. 32, I, D.-6; éth. 60, fols. 27-28, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-16; Orient. 8814, fols. 126r-128r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-15).

I-3)-29. Fols. 44vb-46ra: The Virgin Mary and the blind girl Elisabeth of Bädrǝman (BMirMA 27-28; BHMirM 53-56; ColMirM185-186// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-18; éth. 60, fols. 28-30, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-17; Orient. 8814, fols. 128r-131r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-16).

I-3)-30. Fols. 46ra-46vb: The Virgin Mary and Bishop Mercurius (BMirMA 36-37; BHMirM 71-72; ColMirM287-288// mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-24; éth. 60, fols. 37v-38v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-24; Orient. 8814, fols. 142r-144r, StrBritLib 47, no. 32, 16.-23).
I-3)-31. Fol. 46vb-47va: The Virgin Mary and the epileptic (BMirMA 275 variation).
I-3)-32. Fols. 47va-48vb: The Virgin Mary and the governor ʾArmatyas of Ephesus (ColMirM188-189// mss. d´Abbadie 222, fols. 59v-60v, CRAbb 85, no. 53-XL).
I-3)-33. Fols. 48vb-49rb: The Virgin Mary and the priest John of the monastery of Macarius (Mäqarǝs) (ColMirM 337).
I-3)-34. Fols. 49rb-50rb: The resurrection of the son of a rich man of Cappadocia (Qäpdäqya) (ColMirM 130).

I-3)-35. Fols 50rb-51rb: The Virgin Mary and the thirsty dog (BMirMA 51-52; BHMirM 112 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 102, no. 32, I, D.-32; éth. 60, fols. 56-57, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-33; Orient. 8814, fols. 165v-167v, StrBritLib 48, no. 32, 16.-32).
I-3)-36. Fols. 51rb-54va: The Virgin Mary and the holy communion in Cyprus (E. Cerulli, “Two Ethiopian Tales on the Christian of Cyprus”, JES 5-1: 1-4; EAE I “Cyprus”).
I-3)-37. Fols. 54va-56ra: The young man and the image of the Virgin placed on the gate of the town, on which she lowered her head each time he prostrated in front of it.
I-3)-38. Fols. 56ra-57rb: The Virgin Mary and the beekeeper (BHMirM341-342).
I-3)-39. Fols. 57rb-58rb: The journey of a pious knight on the skies.
I-3)-40. Fols. 58rb-59va: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to a sinful deacon in “the town of the island”.
I-3)-41. Fols. 59va-61rb: Isaac, son of king of Roma Mäsfǝnyos and of his wife Sǝfǝngya (mss. d´Abbadie 165, fols. 62v-63v, CRAbb 80, no. 52-LVII; O Eth. 11, LöfUpp 93, no. 30-51).
I-3)-42. Fols. 61rb-62vb: Daniel of Constantinople and an image of the Virgin Mary.
I-3)-43. Fols. 62vb-63va: Andrew and Bartholomew and the priest ploughing his land on Sunday.
I-3)-44. Fols. 63va-65ra: How the Virgin Mary showed everything they want to people assembled in Däbrä Mǝṭmaq (ColMirM208-210).
I-3)-45. Fols. 65ra-66ra: The Virgin Mary showed hell and heaven to a Roman (Romawi) monk of Däbrä Kwuzara called ʿOṣ (mss. éth. 60, fols.130-131, ZotBNat 65, no. 60-73).
I-3)-46. Fols. 66ra-68vb: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to Ephraim the Potter (The Syrian) (ColMirM373-375).
I-3)-47. Fols. 68vb-69rb: The Virgin Mary and the three monks of Toledo.
I-3)-48. Fols. 69rb-70ra: The great sadness of the Virgin Mary: Miracle read during the Good Friday (Gǝbrä Ḥǝmamat, zäʿarb, Addis Abäba, 1942 E.C., p. 271).

I-3)-49. Fols. 70ra-70va: Jesus Christ and angels will judge the whole world in a church dedicated to the Virgin Mary and located in the valley of Josaphat (Yosafǝṭ) of Jerusalem (mss. EMML 4618, fols. 125v, EMML X 239 no 4618-98; EMML 5492, fols. 24v // EAE II Däbrä Ṣǝyon).
I-3)-50. Fols. 70va-71vb: The celibacy of MarK, king of Rome, son of king Gäbrä Iyasus and the picture of Mary (ColMirM 73-75).
I-3)-51. Fols. 71vb-72rb: The Virgin Mary permitted to a woman at Qaḥra who lost her nine children to give birth to three children.

I-3)-52. Fols. 72rb-73ra: The Virgin Mary and the man called Baruch of Finǝqi (BMirMA 40-41; BHMirM 83-84; CerMaria514-516; ColMirM 60-61 // mss. O Etiop. 15, LöfUpp 101, no. 32, I, D.-26; éth. 60, fols. 43v-44v, ZotBNat 63, no. 60-27; Orient. 8814, fols. 149v-150r, StrBritLib 48, no. 32, 16.-26).
I-3)-53 Fols. 73ra-73va: The Virgin Mary and the peasant called Ildefonsus (Däqǝsyos).
I-3)-54. Fols. 73va-75ra: The vision of a man called ʾAbbas.
I-3)-55. Fols. 75ra-82vb: Andrew, priest of Cesarea (Qisǝrya) who could recite only one office (BMirMA 332-33; CerMaria 29, 38).
I-3)-56. Fols. 76ra-82vb: Apparition of the Virgin Mary at Däbrä Mǝṭmaq accompanied by martyrs and saints (ColMirM197-201).

I-3)-57. Fols. 82vb-83vb: The Annunciation, the day of Hosanna (Hośaʿǝna), the death of the Christ, the discourse of Mary to the disciples about the apparition of Jesus Christ: Miracle read during the day of Hosanna (Gǝbrä Ḥǝmamat, zäʿǝlät Hośaʿǝna, Addis Abäba, 1942 E.C., p. 21-22).
I-3)-58. Fols. 83vb-84vb: Samuel of Wǝldǝbba (gädamä Wali) received from the Virgin Mary a blessing in the form of a pearl (ʿǝnqwa baḥrǝy) (mss. EMML 4618, fols. 118v-119r, EMML X 239, no. 4618-91).
I-3)-59. Fols. 84vb-85va: The Virgin Mary and the starving man.
I-3)-60. Fols. 85va-86rb: The Virgin Mary saved the soul of a murder who washed himself in the spring created by Jesus at the Virgin´s feet.
I-3)-61. Fols. 86rb-87vb: During the journey in Egypt, Jesus Christ raised a spring which cured the daughter of a brigand called Yosafǝṭ (mss. éth 60, fols.139-140, ZotBNat 66, no. 81).
I-3)-62. Fol. 88ra: end of a unidentified miracle
I-3)-63. Fol. 88rb-90ra: The story of the Ark of the Covenant (Tabotä Sion).
I-3)-64. Fols. 90ra-92rb: The story of the Ark of the Covenant (Tabotä Sion): Asqälona (Ascalon), Philistine (ʾIlofǝli).
I-3)-65. Fols. 92rb-94ra: The story of the Ark of the Covenant (Tabotä Sion): Aminadab, Philistine (ʾIlofǝli).
I-3)-66. Fols. 94ra-96rb: The birth of the Virgin Mary (Täsfa Gäbrä Śǝllase (ed.), Täʾamrä Maryam, Addis Abäba, 1956 E.C., p. 23-27).
I-3)-67. Fols. 96va-98va: The conception of the Virgin Mary: A dove, Joachim (ʾIyaqem) and his wife Ann (Ḥanna).
I-3)-68. Fols. 98va-101rb: The entrance of the Virgin Mary into the Temple with her parents, Joachim and Ann when she was three years old and twelve years old (BLedMH127-129variations).

I-3)-69. Fols. 101rb-105vb: Apparition of Gabriel to the Virgin Mary after she took a purple curtain in the Temple in front of the high priest Zacharia, and announcement of her pregnancy (BLedMH 129- ? variations).
I-3)-70. Fols. 105vb-108va: The birth of the Holy Saviour in Bethlehem.
I-3)-71. Fols. 108va-110vb: About the departure of the Virgin Mary: The angel Gabriel brings St. John to the Virgin Mary (mss. éth. 60, fol. 159, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-94).
I-3)-72. Fols. 110vb-112rb: About the departure of the Virgin Mary: The Jew Täfonyas tried to break the bed of the Virgin Mary (mss. éth. 60, fols.153-154, ZotBNat 66, no. 60-90).
I-3)-73. Fols. 112va-113vb: The Assumption of the Virgin Mary.

I-3)-74. Fols. 113vb-115rb: About the departure of the Virgin Mary: How Jesus acted as priest during the day of the Assumption in giving holy communion to the Apostles (mss. éth. 60, fol. 163, ZotBNat 67, no. 60-97).
I-3)-75. Fols. 115rb-117rb: The Virgin received a visit of an angel who asked her to go to the Mount of Olives (Däbrä Zayt).
I-3)-76. Fols. 117rb-118va: Apparition of the Virgin Mary to the Apostles (Täsfa Gäbrä Śǝllase (ed.), Täʾamrä Maryam, Addis Abäba, 1956 E.C, p.101-103).

I-3)-77. Fol. 118va-121vb: Emperor Tiberius (Ṭibaryos) and the resurrection of his son (mss. éth. 62, fols. 50v-53v, ZotBNat 69, no. 62-34; d´Abbadie 165, fols. 65v-67v, CRAbb 81, no. 52-LX, AbbCat174-175)

I-3)-78. Fol. 121vb-124vb: The Virgin Mary, Emperor Tiberius (Ṭibaryos) and St. John (mss. éth. 62, fols. 53v-55, ZotBNat 69, no. 62-35; d’Abbadie 165, fols. 67v-69v, CRAbb 81, no. 52-LXI, AbbCat174-175).
I-3)-79. Fols. 124vb-125vb: The king Naʾod went to the land of Kuzara to plunder it.

msItem.title: II. Täʾamrä Iyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 126ra, l.1: ተአምር፡ ዘገብረ፡ እግዚእነ፡ ወመድኅኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እንዘ፡ ወእቱ፡ በሣህለ፡ ምሕረቱ፡ የሐውጻ፡ ለዓመቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወሶበ፡ ሰምዓት፡ ሰሎሜ፡ መወልዲት፡ ነገሮ…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 144vb, l.15: ኦእግዚእየ፡ ወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፡ ቀደማዊ፡ ዘይሴፈውዎ፡ አሕዛብ፡ ለመድኀኒቶሙ፡ አንተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘተነበዩ፡ ነቢያት፡ በእንቲአከ፡ አንተ፡ ውእቱ፡ ገበሪሁ፡
msItem.note: II-1) Fol. 126r-128r: Glorification of Salome (GrébMJ I589-591// mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 16ra-16vb, StrBritLib 19, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 10va-11rb, GrébGriaule I, 55, no. 17); II-2) Fol. 128r-131v: The fish stolen from a fisherman of Tiberias (GrébMJ I 646-649// mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 28vb-30va, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 14ra-14vb, GrébGriaule I, 56, no. 17); II-3) Fol. 131v-133v: The theft of an heifer in Galila (GréMJ II775-779// mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 30va-32ra, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 14vb-15va, GrébGriaule I, 56, no. 17); II-4) Fol. 133v-135v: The lions of Ascalon (GréMJ III821-824// mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 32ra-33vb, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 38va-39ra, GrébGriaule I, 61, no. 17); II-5) Fol. 135v-138r: The resurrection of the widow of Naim´s son (GréMJ II827-831// mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 48va-50ra, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 28ra-28vb, GrébGriaule I, 58, no. 17); II-6) Fol. 144r-144v: The healing of a man deaf, dumb and blind (GréMJ II823-827// mss. BritMus Orient. 8824, fols. 46vb-48va, StrBritLib 20, no. 16; éth. 321, fols. 27rb-28ra, GrébGriaule I, 58, no. 17).

msItem.title: III. Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Qirqos”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 139ra, l.1: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ነዋ፡ ጸሐፍነተ፡ አምሪሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ንስቲተ፡ እምብዙኃ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይኩን፡ ዝንጋዔ፡ ለሰማዕያን፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ክፍለ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 141vb, l.20: ወከመዝ፡ ገብረ፡ ሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በረከተ፡ ጻሎቱ፡ የሀሎ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ክፍለ፡ ማርያም፡ ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ውሉደ፡ ጥምቀት፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨
msItem.note: II-1) About a pious king who accept to be a priest in the land of Roḥa. III-2) About a believer in a church dedicated to Qirqos. III-3) About a poor monk from a distant country. III-4) About a monk called Eli (ʾElyas).

msItem.title: IV. End of an unidentified text
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 142ra: …ም፡ ወበእንተ፡ አፍቅሮትከ፡ ኪያነ፡ ለበስከ፡ ሥጋ፡ ሰብእ፡ ከመ፡ ትሠሃለኒ፡ ኦወልደ፡ ዳዊት፡ ተሠሃለኒ፡ ወጸግወኒ፡ ብርሃነ፡ ለአዕይንቲየ፡ በከመ፡ ፈታሕከ፡ ልሳንየ፨
msItem.explicit: Fol. 142ra, l.21: ወሖሩ፡ ፈለገ፡ ዮርዳኖስ፨ ወተጠምቁ፡ ባእደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ምጥ[ም]ቅ፨ ሣህለ፡ ምሕረቱ፡ ለእግ˂ዚ˃እነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፨ ˂የሐ˃ውጾ፡ ለገብሩ፡ ክፍለ፡[Fol. 142rb]ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓ˂ለ˃ም፡ አሜን፨

msItem.title: V. Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq “Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 143ra, l.2: ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኆኀተ፡ ምሥራቅ፨ ዘወልደ፡ ኖሬ፡ ሰ፡ ለኪ፡ ዓፀድ፡ ዘእስከ፡ ደሬ…

msItem.title: VI. Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donor (hand b); groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-4; II ; incipit of all other texts, incipit of sections and of subsections (sometimes only the first word); the word täfäśśǝḥi “rejoice” in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 143ra: ተኣምሪሁ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ጻሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብ[Fol. 143rb]ሩ፡ ክፍለ፡ [ማርያም]፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወካዕበ፡ ይቤሉኒ፡ እንዘ፡ ሀሎ፡ ስርናይ፡ መልዕልተ፡ ናሕሰ፡ ዘቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘአንበርዎ…
msItem.explicit: Fol. 144ra, l.11: ወወሰድዎ፡ ኀበ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ወገነዩ፡ ሎቱ፡ በረከቱ፡ ትኵን፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ክፍለ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፤

msItem.note: - ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl bä-kǝlʾe Maryam ... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary ..." (fol. 10ra-rb)
- ʾO-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos kähali ... "O my Lady Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ the Almighty ..." (fol. 10rb-va l.9) (cp. ChRep no. 373)
- Sälam läki ʾo-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝyä Maryam ʾǝmmä mädḫǝn wä-ʾǝmmä bǝrhan... "Salutation to you, o my Lady Mary, Mother of the Saviour and Mother of the Light ..." (fols. 10va l.9-11va).
The miracles of Mary (Text I-4) are numbered.

msItem.colophon: Fol. 12vb: ዝንቱ: መጽሐፍ፡ ዘዑራ፡ ወጢንየ: ቃሉ፡ ዘኢኈለቅ፡ ነገሩ፡ ፈጸምኩ፡ አነ፡ በ{እንተ}ዕበዩ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ መስተጋድል፡ ኢረከብኩ፡ እንበለ፡ ማቅ፡ ወኢፈትል፡ ከመ፡ ይትዋኀሰኒ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ያብኣኒ፡ ውስተ፡ ጽርሑ፡ ሐዳስ። እለ፡ አጽሐፍዋ፡ ወዘጸሐፋ፡ ይጽሐፉ፡ ኀበ፡ ዓምደ፡ ወርቅ፡ ለዓለም፡ አሜን። The note is written in hand a (Zä-Wäldä Maryam).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 144.0 folios, of which 0.0 blank , in 16.0 quires .
22.9 20.0 7.0

signatures.note: Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper margin, - in the main hand: fols. 1r: ፩, 89r: ፪, 97r: ፫, 105r: ፬, 111r:፭, 119r:፮ - in a recent hand: 15r: ፫, 23r: ፬, 31r: ፭, 39r: ፮, 47r: ፯, 57r: ፰, 65r: ፱, 76r: ፲, 88r: ፩, 105r: ፪, 118r: ፫.

supportDesc.condition: The manuscript is very worn and damaged. A part of each board is broken off. The Ms. has been rebound, probably more than once. Text I (quires I-XIII) might have previously been preserved in two codices. The last quire consists of several folios originating from different codices. All quires are reinforced with parchment guards. Some fols. are misplaced (e.g, fols. 46, 142). Holes and tears are carefully amended on fols. 29, 31, 34, 36, 83, 93, 101, 102, 110, 125, 141. 2/3 of fol. 138 is cut off. Fol. 142 is cut in the outer and bottom margin.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: II. Nine dot red and black asterisk;
III. Chain of black and red dots;
Two chains of black and red dots with three nine dot red and black asterisk between (s. fol. 88r);
One black line and one red line (s. fol. 99v);

handDesc.handNote:
Hand a: mediocre but careful Hand b: mediocre Hand c: irregular Black; red. Zä-Wäldä Maryam, Wäldä TǝnśaʾeZä-Wäldä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formulas on fols. 121vb, 124vb and 125vb. He might be the same scribe as that of Ms. QMM-011. Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe is mentioned as the scribe on fol. 138r.Second half of the 18th century.
ሰ fofol. 7rb-va:
ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡
fol. 88ra:
ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡
ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡
ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡
r ሰላም (s. fol. 143, l.2)
Hand a (Zä-Wäldä Maryam): quire I-XIII (Text I); rounded script with wide, broadly spaced letters. Some letters have a big circular vowel marker (e.g., ሎ ቤ ግ).
Hand b (Wäldä Tǝnśaʾe): quires XIV-XV (Text II); angular script.
Hand c: quire XVI (Texts III-V); probably different hands.

list.item: Fol. 142rb: Supplication of the commissioner of writing.Fol. 142rb: አነ፡ ዘአጽሐፍኩ፡ ተ˂አምሪ˃ሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሕፃን፡ ፬˂…˃ዑኒ
- The title ተም፡ ማርያም is written upside down on the front board with black modern paint. - Unreadable note in the bottom margin: fol. 143.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken). Two pairs of sewing stations.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The names of ʿAmdä Mäsqäl and ʾAwad are written in the supplications formulas in quires XI-XIII, in hand a. Further names are mentioned in the concluding formula on fol. 125vb: Gäbrä Dǝngǝl, ʿAsbä Maryam, ʿAmdä Giyorgis. Wälättä Krǝstos is mentioned in the supplications formulas in quires XIV-XV, in hand b. In addition, Kǝflä Maryam is mentioned as the commissioner on fol. 138r. ʾAbunä Kǝflä Maryam is also mentioned in the supplication formulas in quire XVI.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
